properties.name: Art Gallery of Ontario FREE NIGHTS
properties.description: Posted by Designingmama   Wednesdays, from 6-9 pm, is a perfect time to visit the AGO, coz it\'s free!!! Come with your little one in your baby carrier and show them the wonders of Andy Warhol, Claude Monet, Paul Cezanne...

properties.name: Bata Shoe Museum FREE NIGHTS
properties.description: Posted by Designingmama   Thursday nights, from 5-8 pm, you can come and visit the museum for FREE! If you prefer a daytime sojourn, kids under 5 are admitted FREE of charge too! Adult admission is only anyway. On Saturdays beginning October 2005 until April 2006, they also have storytelling at 2 pm (included in the Admission Price) and hands-on please-touch-the-shoes and arts-and-crafts time from 12-4 pm (also included in Admission Price). Pre-registration required for storytelling.

properties.name: Central Eglinton Community Centre
properties.description: Posted by Designingmama  If you\'re looking for inexpensive mom and tots classes like Signing with your Baby, Music with your Baby, Infant Massage, Baby Gym or even drop-off preschooler programmes like the Peanut Club, French classes, and children\'s Yoga, drop by the CECC. They also offer FREE pregnancy and parenting/caregiving classes in hypnobirthing, making Baby Food, and how to fit baby shoes. Also offered are Child Emergency Workshops and space rental for birthday parties (0/60!).

properties.name: Doug Miller Books
properties.description: Posted by Designingmama A fantastic place for booklovers who are raising booklovers. Doug specializes in children\'s books and he sells them for almost half the regular price! You can find both new and well-loved books. My daughter and I never walk out of this store without a book - and at the price that he sells them for, even we can do that! By the way, if there is a specific book or title that you want and that Doug doesn\'t have at the moment, let him know! He\'s more than happy to source it for you!

properties.name: Dufflet Pastries
properties.description: Posted by Designingmama   "Nothing artificial, always delightful." True to their word, Dufflet Pastries use only all natural ingredients. This little bakeshop and cafe up on Yonge is a wonderful place to go for a "coffee" with your little one. My daughter adores their cupcakes and I love their coffee and chocolate mousse tarts (an amazing each!). They also serve yummy samosas!

properties.name: George's Trains
properties.description: Posted by Designingmama   Trains, trains, and more trains! Also model-making materials galore! But best of all, this awesome place has 3 train tables set-up upstairs where little ones are more than welcome to play! A great place to take your kids to on a cold, wet day; the staff never minds parents and tots coming in just to play.

properties.name: Hollywood Gelato
properties.description: Posted by Designingmama  1640 Bayview Avenue Toronto OntarioHollywood\'s gelato and sorbetto are made fresh daily down in their basement kitchen with natural ingredients. Their excellent fruit sorbets are dairy free: mango, coconut, strawberry, lemon, pineapple, are only among the few flavours available. Some of my favourites are tiramisu, rocky roche (their take on that famous round hazelnut chocolate treat), pistachio, and double chocolate walnut brownie. Yum, yum, yum... and at only for a kiddie scoop, and .95 for a regular cone (2 flavours), it\'s an affordable treat. They also have fantastic iced coffee and some baked goods!

properties.name: Hotel California @ the 3rd Street Promenade Santa Monica, CA
properties.description: Posted by Designingmama 1351 3rd Street Promenade, Santa Monica, CAStrolling down the Promenade one hot summer night, I swear I thought that THE EAGLES were serenading me live. It was a man, with his 5-year-old daughter backing him up, singing like angels. 9 years later, I am propelled back to that sidewalk when I hear HOTEL CALIFORNIA.

properties.name: Kenpik Bulk Shop
properties.description: Posted by Designingmama   151 Manor Road East, Toronto, ON M4S 1R7We look forward to our weekly visits to this little neighbourhood bulk food store. Dried mangoes, yogurt-covered raisins, flax seed chips, dried blueberries - healthy, wholesome snacks for everyone for a fraction of the price that you would pay for name brand snacks of the same caliber. I also love their selection of grains like quinoa, kamut, spelt; they also have brown rice, wholewheat pasta, teas, spices galore, baking supplies, and even candy. Definitely a must-visit!

properties.name: Kidnasium Children's Recreational Gymnastics Centre
properties.description: Posted by Designingmama  Kidnasium is a fantastic indoor gym for kids as young as 18 months. The fully equipped gym is practically padded so your little one can run, jump, tumble, and somersault freely. The coaches are great, the programmes are awesome. My daughter started when she was 15 months and could do the straddle before she was 2 years old!

properties.name: Mabel's Fables
properties.description: Posted by Designingmama With the kid-friendliest and most knowledgeable people to help you find any children\'s book that you\'re wanting, Mabel\'s Fables is definitely a mecca for the budding booklover. What\'s more, they offer FREE weekly storytime circles which run every Winter, Spring, and Fall! It\'s a chance for you and your tot to read new books, meet other moms and tots, and just relax amidst the wonderful world of books and educational toys in the store. They also offer frequent buyer points which you can use for future purchases.

properties.name: Mothercraft
properties.description: Posted by Designingmama  This amazing, nurturing place should be every new mother\'s home away from home - it sure was ours! They offer FREE classes for new parents like When Baby Comes Home, Sleep - Yours and Your Baby\'s, Baby Food Making, Infant Massage, Mom-Infant playgroups, etc. Also FREE classes to stimulate your baby, toddler, preschooler and help you teach them: Puzzle time, Shapes and Colours, Numbers and Letters, Connect and Build. The facility is completely nut-free too and it\'s perfectly alright ot breastfeed while sitting in one of these classes! Also offered sometimes are Mom-Baby Yoga, Reading to your Baby, Play for the Senses and there are always the FREE drop-in programmes. Visit their website to learn more.

properties.name: PJ's Pet Centre @ Yonge/Eglinton Centre
properties.description: Posted by Designingmama   A little pet store inside the mall - kids get to visit cute little puppies, bunnies, kittens, and a talking parrot or 2. Great little place to buy a child\'s first pet, like a fish. They sell the betta kits too and the fish only cost a couple of bucks.

properties.name: ROM Royal Ontario Museum FREE NIGHTS
properties.description: Posted by Designingmama   On Fridays, from 4:30 onwards, admission to the ROM is FREE!!! A favourite stop for kids are the CIBC Room (a hands-on space where you can dig for dinosaur bones, try on an armour, draw, make a craft, etc) and the Hands-on Biodiversity Gallery (stuffed and live animal displays, a bat cave, real honeybees, etc). Even kids under 5 are welcome to wander around and play!

properties.name: Richmond Hospital, BC
properties.description: Posted by Designingmama The last place and the last time that I woke up with him alive.

properties.name: Toronto Public Library's Shakespeare in Action
properties.description: Posted by Designingmama   165 McRae Drive Toronto, ON M4G 1S8An incredible FREE 6-week Saturday morning Shakespeare programme for kids 7-12 years old! Through theatre games, acting and creating scenes, and play-reading, kids can learn about "A Midsummer Night\'s Dream", "Romeo and Juliet", and "The Tempest." Take-home materials are also free! Ongoing in various locations - check out the website!

properties.name: designingmama
properties.description: Posted by Designingmama 200 balliol street toronto ontario m4s 1c6Awesome, eye-catching, one-of-a-kind personalized invitations, announcements, pgreeting cards, posters, postcards, newsletters -- in digital format for emailing or actual printed cards! See your family or child featured in a professionally-designed card for any occasion. Best of all, it\'s all so affordable!

properties.name: lemonlime kids
properties.description: Posted by Designingmama  239 soudan avenue toronto ontario "Dedicated to bringing joy and inspiration to children\'s room through handpainted art," lemonlime kids is the source for charming, handpainted, and personalized acrylics on canvas, growth charts, and other handpainted children\'s bedroom\'s accessories. The prices are incredible - a fraction of what you would pay if you went to a big-name store, but the quality is the same.
